page.title: 16Shurland Ghosts - Eastchurch
page.content: Shurland Hall today is in a poor state of repair and although it has a {preservation}order on it little has been done to preserve it. Three years ago the villagers of Eastchurch tried, unsuccessfully to make it into a {museum. A feature of the Hall which still remains is that it is{haunted.}In an extract from a letter written by an unnamed Victorian lady were descriptions of mysterious bells, barking dogs and of a lady in black appearing in the Hall at midnight. Other{supernatural}happenings involved infestations of spiders foretelling death and weird noises. An entry from a parish register in 1769 told of Grace David drowning herself in the Old House Pond suggesting the source of the hauntings.
